metadata.title: CVE-2019-18680 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 4.4.x before 4.4.195. There isa NULL pointer dereference in rds_tcp_kill_sock() in net/rds/tcp.c thatwill cause denial of service, aka CID-91573ae4aed0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1062-kvm - 4.4.0-1062.69
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1098-aws - 4.4.0-1098.109
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1125-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1125.134
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1129.137
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.69').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.109').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.134').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.137').
